strategy:
Use LightGBM with the following settings: num_leaves=31, learning_rate=0.1, n_estimators=1000. For preprocessing, fill numeric NaN values with the median and apply Label Encoding to categorical variables. Do not use get_dummies. Ensure all features are numeric before training. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categorical columns to strings before encoding.

(VS suggestion: Refine the LightGBM model by adjusting the learning rate to 0.03 and increasing the number of estimators to 1000, while maintaining the same preprocessing pipeline (missing values imputed with median, categorical variables one-hot encoded). This incremental reduction in learning rate and increase in iterations can lead to better convergence and reduced overfitting, potentially improving the model's generalization on unseen data. The slight learning rate decrease allows for more stable updates, while the increased iterations give the model more opportunities to capture subtle patterns in the data without introducing noise.)

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then label encode
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)

# Label encode categorical features
le = LabelEncoder()
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = le.fit_transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
    X_val[col] = le.transform(X_val[col])

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMRegressor(
    num_leaves=31,
    learning_rate=0.1,
    n_estimators=1000,
    random_state=42
)

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then label encode
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)

# Label encode categorical features
le = LabelEncoder()
for col in categorical_columns:
    # Fit on training data only to avoid unseen labels
    le.fit(X_train[col])
    X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
    X_val[col] = le.transform(X_val[col])

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMRegressor(
    num_leaves=31,
    learning_rate=0.1,
    n_estimators=1000,
    random_state=42
)

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
y_val_pred = model.predict(X_val)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')
validation = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)
X_val = validation.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_val = validation['SalePrice']

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())
X_val[numeric_columns] = X_val[numeric_columns].fillna(X_val[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then label encode
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)
    X_val[col] = X_val[col].astype(str)

# Label encode categorical features (fit only on training data)
le = LabelEncoder()
for col in categorical_columns:
    le.fit(X_train[col])
    X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])
    X_val[col] = le.transform(X_val[col])

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMRegressor(
    num_leaves=31,
    learning_rate=0.1,
    n_estimators=1000,
    random_state=42
)

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then label encode
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Label encode categorical features (fit only on training data)
le = LabelEncoder()
for col in categorical_columns:
    # Fit on training data only to avoid unseen labels
    le.fit(X_train[col])
    X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMRegressor(
    num_leaves=31,
    learning_rate=0.1,
    n_estimators=1000,
    random_state=42
)

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
from lightgbm import LGBMRegressor

# Load data
train = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train.drop(['Id', 'SalePrice'], axis=1)
y_train = train['SalePrice']
X_test = test.drop(['Id'], axis=1)

# Fill NaN values in numeric columns with median
numeric_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=[np.number]).columns
X_train[numeric_columns] = X_train[numeric_columns].fillna(X_train[numeric_columns].median())
X_test[numeric_columns] = X_test[numeric_columns].fillna(X_test[numeric_columns].median())

# Handle categorical columns: convert to string, then label encode
categorical_columns = X_train.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
for col in categorical_columns:
    X_train[col] = X_train[col].astype(str)
    X_test[col] = X_test[col].astype(str)

# Label encode categorical features (fit only on training data)
le = LabelEncoder()
for col in categorical_columns:
    # Fit on training data only to avoid unseen labels
    le.fit(X_train[col])
    X_train[col] = le.transform(X_train[col])
    X_test[col] = le.transform(X_test[col])

# Train LightGBM model
model = LGBMRegressor(
    num_leaves=31,
    learning_rate=0.1,
    n_estimators=1000,
    random_state=42
)

model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on test set
y_test_pred = model.predict(X_test)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'Id': test['Id'],
    'SalePrice': y_test_pred
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
